value.title: Explore modules, packages, and third-party crates
value.excerpt: Learn about how to effectively use modules and how to integrate with packages and third-party crates.

value.title: Scan open source components for vulnerabilities and license ratings in Azure Pipelines
value.excerpt: Scan open-source components for security vulnerabilities and assess their license ratings when your application builds in Azure Pipelines.

value.title: Secure your application by using OpenID Connect and Azure AD
value.excerpt: In this module, you will learn how to enable users to authenticate in multiple systems by using their Azure AD identities.

value.title: Secure an ASP.NET Core web app with the Identity framework
value.excerpt: Add authentication and authorization to an ASP.NET Core web app using the Identity framework.

value.title: Secure your Azure SQL Database
value.excerpt: Secure an Azure SQL database to keep the information safe and diagnose potential security concerns as they happen.

value.title: Set up an IoT Edge Gateway
value.excerpt: This module is theoretical and will walk you through how an IoT Edge device can be used as a gateway.

value.title: Store and share files in your application with Azure Files
value.excerpt: Azure Files provides a cloud-based file share for storing and sharing files to applications. Whether it's an application hosted in Azure App Service, an Azure VM, or an on-premises app, Azure Files can store and share file access between one or more applications and systems in a secure and failure-resilient manner.

value.title: Core Cloud Services - Manage services with the Azure portal
value.excerpt: Get acquainted with the Azure cloud platform through the Azure portal, where you create and manage all of your Azure resources.

value.title: Work with Compute in Azure Machine Learning
value.excerpt: Learn how to manage compute contexts for experiments in Azure Machine Learning.

value.title: 60 seconds to a Linkerd service mesh on AKS | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: See just how easy it is to deploy a service mesh to your AKS cluster. William Morgan, maintainer of the open source service mesh Linkerd, joins Scott Hanselman to demonstrate just how easy it is to deploy Linkerd. Together they explore how to debug a live microservices application using the service mesh,

value.title: Anomaly detection using machine learning in Azure Stream Analytics | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Azure Stream Analytics is a fully managed serverless offering on Azure. value.title: Autoscale applications on Kubernetes with Kubernetes Event-Driven Autoscaling (KEDA) | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Do you want to scale your workloads on Kubernetes without having to worry about the details? Do you want to run Azure Functions anywhere and easily scale it yourself? Tom Kerkhove shows Scott Hanselman how Kubernetes Event-Driven Autoscaling (KEDA) makes application autoscaling dead simple.  0:00 – Introduction

value.title: Azure App Service Web Apps | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Byron Tardif joins Scott Hanselman to discuss Azure App Service Web Apps, the best way to build and host web applications in the programming language of your choice without managing infrastructure. It offers auto-scaling and high availability, supports both Windows and Linux, and enables automated deployments
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/jCfJWYocz1M" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Azure Arc enabled Kubernetes with GitOps | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Lior Kamrat shows Scott Hanselman how Azure Arc enabled Kubernetes provides an easy way to apply GitOps configurations on Kubernetes clusters deployed outside of Azure, which enables you to control and govern those clusters and applications using GitHub repositories as the "single source of truth."

value.title: Azure Automation | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Jenny Hunter joins Scott Hanselman to discuss Azure Automation, which has seen several new improvements including support for Python 2, the ability to run against local Linux machines, the ability to run against any Azure VM with no setup (Run Command), and native Azure alert integration. value.title: Azure Security Center | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Kelly Anderson joins Scott Hanselman to discuss Azure Security Center, which offers built-in security management and threat protection for your cloud workloads.
